site.title: Cassandra Philogene – Portfolio
site.tagline: Electrical Engineering · Robotics · Electronics · CAD · Programming

about.heading: About
about.text: Electrical Engineering student at Concordia University focused on embedded systems, robotics, and power electronics. I build and validate prototypes through schematic and simulation work, integration and wiring, and iterative testing. I document design decisions so systems are repeatable and debuggable.

projects.title: SAE Aero Design – Electrical Systems
projects.subtitle: Concordia University · 2025 – Present
projects.description: Electrical systems work for a competition RC aircraft: power distribution, harnessing, integration, and troubleshooting during build and flight testing.
bullets: Electrical architecture: power distribution and wiring/harnessing approach
Assembly and integration: connectors, routing, continuity checks, subsystem bring-up
Debug support: fault isolation for shorts and intermittent connections during prototyping
Flight-test support: review observations/telemetry and propose integration changes

projects.title: Robowars Competition – Autonomous Robot
projects.subtitle: Competition · April 2025
projects.description: Autonomous Arduino-based robot designed for real-time behavior using sensor feedback and motor actuation.
bullets: Control logic: sensor read → decision logic → actuation loop on Arduino Nano
Integrated sensors and motor driver; tuned behavior for stable real-time response
Improved robustness through mounting, wiring strain relief, and iteration

projects.title: Autonomous Hovercraft – Prototype & CAD
projects.subtitle: Project · December 2025
projects.description: Autonomous hovercraft prototype focused on CAD-to-build integration, electronics bring-up, and iterative testing for maze navigation.
bullets: Fusion 360 CAD for manufacturable layout and stable packaging
Electronics integration and bring-up: wiring, sensor checks, incremental testing
Navigation behavior iteration based on test results (tuning and debugging)

projects.title: Buck Converter PCB (BEC) (Planned / In Progress)
projects.subtitle: SAE Club Project · Target: March 2026
projects.description: Planned power electronics project to design a buck converter PCB for a stable power rail for RC/aircraft electronics.
bullets: Goal: architecture and component selection (controller, inductor, protections)
Goal: schematic and BOM; LTspice validation (stability and transient response)
Goal: PCB layout fundamentals (grounding, decoupling, high di/dt loop control)

projects.title: ROS2 Chess Robot Arm (Planned / In Progress)
projects.subtitle: IEEE Club Project · Target: Summer 2026
projects.description: Planned robotics project to build a ROS2-based control stack for a robotic arm to execute chess moves reliably and safely.
bullets: Goal: ROS2 nodes in Python for command handling and state feedback
Goal: motion execution pipeline (kinematics and trajectory generation)
Goal: safety constraints (joint limits, workspace bounds) and documentation

contact.heading: Contact
contact.note: Open to internship opportunities — Summer and Winter 2026.
